ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: Plot a cumulative distribution function with lower, median, and upper quantiles.

SYNTAX.LINE: plot_cdf(points [, name="x", xlabel="x", replot=False, overplot=False, clearwindow=True])

DESC.PARA: The plot_cdf() function plots the cumulative probability distribution function (cdf) of a specified array of histogram values (a NumPY ndarray), with the given plot title and x-axis label (default is "x" for each). The median and upper/lower quantiles are marked by orange and blue, vertical, dashed lines, respectively.

ROW.DATA: NumPy ndarray of histogram data values
title to assign to the plot
label to assign to the x-axis
Should previously-calculated arrays be used to create the plot?
If True, then add the data to the current plot, otherwise erase the frame and create a new plot.
If True, then do not delete any existing frames in the current ChIPS window. Note that the plots will be created in a new ChIPS frame even when this argument is set.

DESC.PARA: Define a histogram in the variable "x" and plot the corresponding cumulative probability density function with default settings.
DESC.VERBATIM: sherpa> import numpy as np sherpa> mu, sigma = 100, 15 sherpa> x = mu + sigma*np.random.randn(10000) sherpa> plot_cdf(x)

DESC.PARA: Plot the cumulative density function for a simulated energy flux distribution returned by the sample_energy_flux() command (see 'ahelp sample_energy_flux'), using a custom plot title and x-axis label.
DESC.VERBATIM: sherpa> a = sample_energy_flux(0.5,7.,num=1000) sherpa> plot_energy_flux() sherpa> x = a[:,0] sherpa> plot_cdf(x, name="Energy Flux CDF", xlabel="flux")
